articles.title: Europe's space agency to hire first disabled astronaut - The Straits Times
articles.description: BERLIN • The European Space Agency (ESA) hopes to hire and launch the world's first physically disabled astronaut, and several hundred would-be para-astronauts have already applied for the role, ESA head Josef Aschbacher said.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: Australia battles Delta Covid surge as Europe eases restrictions - eNCA
articles.description: Sydney's normally bustling harbourside centre was nearly deserted after its lockdown took effect, with officials bracing the public for a spiralling crisis.
articles.content:
"We do need to brace ourselves for a potentially large number of cases in the following days," said Gladys Berejiklian, the Premier of New South Wales state.

articles.title: Scientists find Neanderthal ancestor, challenging what we thought about human evolution - USA TODAY
articles.description: After studying fossils in Israel, scientists found a new kind of early human that challenges what we thought about pre-Neanderthal groups in Europe.
articles.content:
Paleontologists discovered the fossilized remains of a 98 million-year-old titanosaur in Argentina. Titanosaurs a group of large sauropod dinosaurs.
